chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines: Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts. Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'. Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary. Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided. Example 1: Hypotheses: n, m: nat IHn: m + n = n + m Goal: m + S n = S n + m Proof: ```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` Example 2: Hypotheses: Goal: forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m ```intros n m. induction n. - simpl. auto. - simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` Sovle This Proof State: Hypotheses: X: Type y: X x: X ll: list X l: list X Goal: x :: l

x = y /\ l

~ In x ll /\ list_injective ll list_pick : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k < length ll -> {x : X & {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ length l = k}}} map_cst_snoc : forall (X Y : Type) (y : Y) (ll : list X) (mm : list Y), y :: map (fun _ : X => y) ll ++ mm = map (fun _ : X => y) ll ++ y :: mm prefix_app_lft : forall l r1 r2 : list X, r1

l ++ r1

length l <= length m flat_map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> list Y) (l : list X) (r1 : list Y) (y : Y) (r2 : list Y), flat_map f l = r1 ++ y :: r2 -> exists (l1 : list X) (m1 : list Y) (x : X) (m2 : list Y) (l2 : list X), l = l1 ++ x :: l2 /\ f x = m1 ++ y :: m2 /\ r1 = flat_map f l1 ++ m1 /\ r2 = m2 ++ flat_map f l2 list_an_duplicate_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l : list nat) (x : nat) (m list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' Inductive Desc (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := d_nil : Relation_Operators.Desc A leA nil | d_one : forall x : A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x :: nil) | d_conc : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil) list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0 Forall2_sind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> SProp), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
